intro: Myriocladus steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and delicate, feathery plumes. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky slopes and disturbed soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by wind. Myriocladus steyermarkii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
